alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 2:42PM CDT until further notice by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...THE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CAMERON COUNTY... At 242 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to one inch of rain has already fallen. Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Port Of Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, B I S D Administration Building, Longoria Elementary School, Sams Memorial Stadium and Hanna High School.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely. A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
